trans-unit.source: Represents a claim that is associated with an entity.
The Identity Model is a claims-based authorization system.
Claims describe the capabilities associated with some entity in the system, often a user of that system.
The set of claims associated with a given entity can be thought of as a key.
The particular claims define the shape of that key; much like a physical key is used to open a lock in a door.
In this way, claims are used to gain access to resources.
Access to a given protected resource is determined by comparing the claims required to access that resource with the claims associated with the entity that attempts access.
A claim is the expression of a right with respect to a particular value.
A right could be read, write, or possess.
A value could be a database, a file, a mailbox, or a property.
Claims also have a claim type.
The combination of claim type and right provides the mechanism for capabilities being specified with respect to the value.
For example, a claim of type `file` with the right `read` over the value `biography.doc` indicates that the entity with such a claim has read access to the file biography.doc.

A claim of type name with the right <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A> over the value `Martin` indicates that the entity with the claim possesses a `Name` property with the value `Martin`.
Although various claim types and rights are defined as part of Identity Model, the system is extensible.
The various systems building on top of the Identity Model infrastructure can define claim types and rights as required.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> class with the specified type, resource, and right.

[!INCLUDE[vsindigo](~/includes/vsindigo-md.md)] ships a set of pre-defined claim types and rights that are represented as members of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimTypes> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights> classes.
A uniform resource identifier (URI) that represents a claim type.
The object with which the new claim is associated.
The URI of the right associated with the claim.
claimType is `null`.
-or-
right is `null`.
claimType is zero length.
-or-
right is zero length.
Gets the type of the claim.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> property can be one of the pre-defined claim types that are represented by the static properties of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimTypes> class.
Claim types specify the type of claim that is being asserted, such as an email address.
A URI that represents the type of the claim.
Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object that represents a deny-only specified security identifier (SID).
The deny-only SID is a SID_AND_ATTRIBUTES structure with the SE_GROUP_USE_FOR_SENY_ONLY flag set.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> object this method creates has the property values shown in the following table.
Property
Value
The value of the `sid` parameter.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A>.
A that represents the SID specified in the identifier parameter.
identifier is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object that represents the specified Domain Name System (DNS) name.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> object this method creates has the property values shown in the following table.
Property
Value
The value of the `dns` parameter.
The DNS name of the entity associated with the claim.
This parameter must not be `null`.
If this parameter is `null`, this method throws a <xref href="System.ArgumentNullException"></xref> exception.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object this method creates.
The dns parameter is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object that represents the specified hash value.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> object this method creates has the property values shown in the following table.
Property
Value
The value of the `hash` parameter.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A>.
An array of byte values that specifies a hash value.
This parameter must not be `null`.
If this parameter is `null`, this method throws a <xref href="System.ArgumentNullException"></xref> exception.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object this method creates.
The hash parameter is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object that represents the specified email address.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> object this method creates has the property values shown in the following table.
Property
Value
The value of the `mailAddress` parameter.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Net.Mail.MailAddress"></xref> that specifies the email address this claim represents.
This parameter must not be `null`.
If this parameter is `null`, this method throws an <xref href="System.ArgumentNullException"></xref> exception.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object this method creates.
The mailAddress parameter is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object that represents the specified name.

Property
Value
The value of the `name` parameter.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A>.
The name of the entity associated with the claim.
This parameter must not be `null`.
If this parameter is `null`, this method throws an <xref href="System.ArgumentNullException"></xref> exception.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object this method creates.
The name parameter is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object that represents the specified RSA key.

Value

<xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A>.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.RSA"></xref> object that represents an RSA cryptographic key.
This parameter must not be `null`.
If this parameter is `null`, this method throws an <xref href="System.ArgumentNullException"></xref> exception.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object this method creates.
The rsa parameter is `null`.

If this parameter is `null`, this method throws an <xref href="System.ArgumentNullException"></xref> exception.

If this parameter is `null`, this method throws an <xref href="System.ArgumentNullException"></xref> exception.

Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object that represents the specified security identifier (SID).

Property
Value
The value of the `sid` parameter.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> that represents the SID.
A that represents the SID specified in the sid parameter.
sid is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object that represents the specified X.500 distinguished name.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> object this method creates has the property values shown in the following table.
The value of the `x500DistinguishedName` parameter.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName"></xref> that specifies the X.500 distinguished name of the entity associated with the claim.
This parameter must not be `null`.
If this parameter is `null`, this method throws an <xref href="System.ArgumentNullException"></xref> exception.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object this method creates.
The x500DistinguishedName parameter is `null`.
Gets an object that can compare two <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> objects for equality.
Use the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.DefaultComparer%2A> property to match any of the pre-defined claim types.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer`1"></xref> interface implementation that compares two <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> objects.
Determines whether the specified object represents the same claim as the current <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object.
This method overrides the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> method to provide equality comparisons for <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> objects.

The comparison consists of three comparisons on the values of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Right%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Resource%2A> properties.

The comparison algorithm that is used on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Resource%2A> property depends upon the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> property.
The following table details the comparison algorithm that is used for the specified claim type.
Claim type
Comparison
Case insensitive string comparison on the resource.
Byte-by-byte comparison.
Byte-by-byte comparison on the Modulus and Exponent parts of the algorithm.
Byte-by-byte comparison.
SID comparison.
Normalized X.500 raw data comparison.
The object to compare with the current <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref>.
`true` if obj represents the same claim as the current ; otherwise `false`.
Returns a hash code for the current claim.
This method generates the same hash code for two objects that are equal according to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Equals%2A> method.
The hash code for the claim.
Gets the resource with which this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object is associated.
The resource with which this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object is associated.
A string representation of a uniform resource identifier (URI) that specifies the right associated with this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object.
Pre-defined rights are available as static properties of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights"></xref> class.
Pre-defined values include <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.Identity%2A>and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A>.
A URI that specifies the right associated with this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object.
A pre-defined claim that represents the system entity.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object that represents the system entity.
This <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object has the property values shown in the following table.
Property
Value
Returns a string representation of this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object.
The string that is returns contains the values of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Right%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> properties.
This <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> object.
